lead_paragraph: The camp perched at the edge of the English Channel has doubled in size, a highly visible symbol of Europe’s inability to cope with the migrant influx.

byline.original: By ADAM NOSSITER and TYLER HICKS

headline.print_headline: Inside ‘the Jungle’: Migrant Crisis on Full View
headline.main: Inside France’s ‘Jungle’: Desperate Migrants Keep Coming to Calais

snippet: The camp perched at the edge of the English Channel has doubled in size, a highly visible symbol of Europe’s inability to cope with the migrant influx....
abstract: Unauthorized refugee camp known as the Jungle on French side of English Channel in Calais has almost doubled in size since March to 8,000 migrants from Afghanistan, Sudan, Eritrea and elsewhere; ramshackle camp is prominent symbol of Europe's inability to cope with refugees, many of them young men.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
